result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin Scot Lecher appeared by video in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by video for Dustin Scot Lecher. Atty Cupino requesting cash bond be amended to signature bond. State- Deft wanted to clear up his warrant in Ozaukee Cty, so he requested a signature bond- objects to any bond modification. Court believes cash is necessary in this case. Court denies bond modification at this time. Atty Cupino requests a status 3 Weeks out, still needs to obtain some discovery.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's
